46:59 Caption: Up to now the game has been rather average in terms of entertainment, with little in the way of thrilling moments. It's difficult to say if one side enjoyed any superiority over the other in the first half. Both team's main weapon is fast counter-attacks.

50:59 Caption: We can only hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and spark them into life in the next games. The football on offer today has been disappointing. Both teams tried unsuccessfully to control the game. Their overall performances were more or less even. The strategy of the home side was to control the pace of the match with possession style football. Whereas the strategy of the away side was a bit risky and reliant on solid defending to dispossess the opponent and break fast.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The highly anticipated Serie A clash between Fiorentina and AC Milan ended in a goalless draw, with both teams failing to capitalize on their chances despite a thrilling encounter. The match took place at the Stadio Artemio Franchi, and although it ended 0-0, the performance and the efforts of both sides provided plenty of talking points.

**First Half:**

The game kicked off at the Stadio Artemio Franchi with AC Milan starting with the ball. However, the initial minutes were somewhat scrappy with the ball going out of play multiple times. Within the first nine seconds, the ball was already out of play, and by the 21st second, Fiorentina took a throw-in to resume the play. These early moments were marked by a succession of throw-ins from both sides, indicating a tentative start by both squads.

By the first minute, Fiorentina had managed to put up an early shot off target, showcasing their intent right from the beginning. Nevertheless, AC Milan's defense was well-positioned, resulting in a clearance. The back and forth continued, with both sides struggling to keep hold of the ball for extended periods.

The first notable incident came in the 2nd minute when Fiorentina committed a foul, leading to a yellow card—an early indication of the physical nature of the match. AC Milan received a direct free-kick following this, taking their first shot on target only to be dispossessed soon after due to a foul. Fiorentina attempted another shot off target shortly after, displaying their aggressive frontage but falling short of the mark.

Despite Fiorentina's attempts, AC Milan's counter-attacks were swift and precise. In the 18th minute, Carlos Bacca of AC Milan found himself flagged for offside. By the 21st minute, Fiorentina managed to get a shot on target, but the move was marred by a foul by an AC Milan player leading to a yellow card for Davide Calabria. This foul resulted in a penalty for Fiorentina, a golden opportunity to take the lead. Josip Ilicic stepped up to take it but was unable to convert, with the ball striking the right post and bouncing out.

Midway through the first half, both teams had spells of possession but neither could make a significant breakthrough. AC Milan's Niang showed flashes of brilliance, around the 17th minute, forcing a rebound shot over the bar. Fiorentina, on the other hand, kept pushing forward but their efforts were repeatedly thwarted by AC Milan's well-organized defensive line.

The middle phase of the first half lacked any significant attacks with both teams focused on maintaining possession and probing their respective defenses. It wasn’t until the 29th minute that Fiorentina’s Federico Bernardeschi offered the home fans something to cheer about when he found himself thwarted by an on-form Gianluigi Donnarumma.

A yellow card handed out to Riccardo Montolivo towards the end of the first half highlighted the tense atmosphere on the field. This physical element, embodied by late tackles and tactical fouls, was a constant theme throughout the first half. Both teams seemed intent on neutralizing each other's attacks, and were unafraid to put in a hard tackle when necessary.

Towards the very end of the first half, AC Milan received another yellow card, illustrating their desperation to ensure they entered halftime without conceding. It was a half that showcased just how evenly matched these two teams were. Neither Fiorentina nor AC Milan could boast about their dominance, as the half was punctuated with stops, starts, and missed opportunities.

As the whistle blew for halftime, it was evident that while the first half didn’t produce any goals, it surely wasn't lacking in drama. The scrappy nature of the game, combined with the physical battles, set the stage for an intriguing second half.

**Second Half:**

The second half resumed with Fiorentina kicking off and immediately setting the tone for what was to come—a persistent push to break the deadlock. Within the first minute, Fiorentina managed a promising shot on target. Iglesias Borja Valero seized an opportunity and aimed for the roof of the net, but AC Milan’s goalkeeper produced a superb save, keeping the score at 0-0.

The aggressive start continued as AC Milan found themselves conceding a multiple fouls leading to another yellow card. Not to be undone, Fiorentina also saw their players challenging hard, leading to frequent stoppages in play, reflecting the intensity and urgency among both sets of players.

By the 12th minute, Fiorentina had multiple shots on target, forcing the AC Milan goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma to make repeated saves. Fiorentina even brought in fresh legs, substituting Matias Vecino for Gonzalo Rodriguez to maintain their offensive pressure. This momentum allowed Fiorentina to keep pressing and almost break through several times, but AC Milan’s defense held strong.

AC Milan, too, had their moments in the second half. Around the 17th minute, Suso found himself in a one-on-one position with Fiorentina’s goalkeeper, only to be denied brilliantly. However, these moments of attacking play from AC Milan were few and far between as Fiorentina controlled more of the ball during this period, making life harder for AC Milan’s defenders.

AC Milan decided to make a substitution at the 24th minute, bringing on Manuel Locatelli for M'Baye Niang. They felt it necessary to inject some fresh energy into their side to counteract Fiorentina's relentless attacks. Moments later, Josip Ilicic tested Donnarumma again with a long-range effort which saw the AC Milan keeper make another commendable save.

This rhythm continued as both teams alternated between attacking and defensive strategies. In the 30th minute, Fiorentina, with a well-placed free-kick, managed another shot at goal although it too bore no fruit. Paulo Sousa, the Fiorentina manager, opted for another change at 37 minutes, bringing on Khouma Babacar to replace Josip Ilicic, indicating their commitment to pushing for a win.

Despite their vigorous efforts, Fiorentina could still not find a way past Donnarumma. A moment of near brilliance came when Nikola Kalinic struck a powerful shot from outside the penalty area, forcing the AC Milan goalkeeper into an agile save. Fiorentina's frustration was apparent as they continued to craft opportunities without a final product.

The closing stages of the game saw a string of substitutions from both sides as they each made tactical adjustments, seeking that one decisive moment. Carlos Bacca of AC Milan came close in the 37th minute but his shot went inches wide of the right post.

In the dying moments of the game, Fiorentina continued piling on the pressure, but it remained unyielding as the AC Milan defense, marshaled by Donnarumma, cleared their lines effectively. In the additional time, a final yellow card was shown to Luca Antonelli of AC Milan for his infringement. Both teams tried tirelessly till the end, but as the referee blew the final whistle, the scoreline remained frozen at 0-0.

**Conclusion:**

Reflecting on this fiercely contested match, one couldn't help but acknowledge the superb goalkeeping from both sides. Gianluigi Donnarumma and Ciprian Tatarusanu were pivotal in ensuring their respective teams kept a clean sheet. Fiorentina will rue their missed chances, particularly the penalty that struck the woodwork, but they'll also take solace in their dominant spells and robust defending.

AC Milan, on the other hand, will be pleased with their defensive solidity, which withstood Fiorentina’s numerous attacking forays, showcasing their resilience and tactical discipline. Their strategy of fast counter-attacks, while not yielding goals, kept the match open and competitive.

Both teams highlighted a strong physical presence, evident from the multiple yellow cards and fouls committed. It was a game that lacked the final cutting edge but more than made up for it in terms of sheer determination and defensive prowess.

As the dust settled, while the match ended in a stalemate, the performance of both Fiorentina and AC Milan suggested that they each have the capability to succeed further this season. The fans witnessed a defensive masterclass and a tactical battle that, despite lacking goals, provided a gripping encounter from start to finish. Both managers would likely go back to the drawing board, focusing on converting these near misses into winners in their subsequent fixtures.
